title: Crakin' film
review: Very, very clever. Not since Usual Suspects have I enjoyed such a beautifully crafted story. Well done to all involved.

title: One trick pony?!
review: Potential to be a great film, but lacked substance other than Dentil Washington playing his usual smart mouthed, quick talking hustler. I have yet to see him play a role that clearly demonstrates has ability

title: Dreadful
review: Utter mixed rubbish and not a patch on the first Thor

title: Excellent, but struggled
review: Very touching and well acted film, but my only complaint was Cases Affleck mumbles to the point of being incoherent. Open your mouth more in future my boy

title: Disjointed, puffed up nothing
review:
What were the writers on?!!!
Drivel in gigantic, cinematography marshmallow form of noise mayhem, visual effects which quite frankly the popcorn was the highlight.

title: Weird as a really strange thing
review: Slow, confusing, odd - verrryy odd. Not entirely sure what to make of it, but worth watching once.

title: 2 hours that brought hope to my heart
review: Beautiful tale, absolutely beautiful. Beautifully made, acted well and just an absolute pleasure from start to finish.There is true love out there.

title: Better than the first DK
review: Pretty good. Interesting plot. Bane is great. Spoiled by Anne Hathaway - first film I have seen her in but took an instant dislike.to her

title: Decent plot, but who picked the actors?!
review: Having enjoyed all Marvel based films i started watching this with great expectations. As soon as Martin Freeman came on it was turned off. Why, why, why, why does the film industry trot out the same talentless dumwits who couldn't act in a pantomine?

title: Gorgeously shot but self-obsessed and boring
review: A very disappointing tale although visually very pleasing on the eye. Another thing - why oh why Martin Freeman, the man can't act for toffee!!!!

title: Entertaining from start to finish
review: This has got to be my favourite Comic Book film - funny, poignant, full of action, wit, sarcasm and a brilliant plot

title: What a pile of.....
review: Convoluted, too stylised, no plot. So many bad points I failed to see anything good worth mentioning.
